post.date: Posted: Wed Sep 06, 2006 1:34 am Post subject: Multimaterials Textures & Der_ton MD5 exporter.
post.author: 6th Venom
post.body:
Hi, i want to know if there is a "fix" to this problem:

When i make a model into Max using multimaterials material (multi/sub-object), then exporting it with the Der_ton's MD5 exporter V0.92, i always got to replace (re-put, re-place) textures in the right order.
I mean if i export a model of a green ball on a red cube on a blue pyramide, my MD5mesh will be a blue ball on a green cube on a red pyramide (or anything else) 8/10 times.

I noticed it's not an alphabetic issue, but maybe an "old age" elements INTO the model exported. something like "you modelled head first, so i export it first, then you add a torso, so the torso will be the second, etc...", or maybe i'm totally wrong, an that's something else.

It's not a big problem, cause i put manually materials at right places in the md5mesh, but, you know...

Do you got this problem? Is it solvable? Did i miss a tuts on this?
Thanks in advance.
_________________
I just wanna make something not made...

post.date: Posted: Thu Sep 07, 2006 9:54 pm Post subject:
post.author: der_ton
post.body:
Your observation is correct, obihb reported this bug too and I looked into it but didn't find the reason why MaxScript doesn't get the actual mapping of materials and material numbers. Sorry there is no fix that I knew of at the time I investigated this.
_________________
Staff
Modelviewer | 3DSMax<->MD5 | Blender<->MD5

post.date: Posted: Thu Sep 07, 2006 9:59 pm Post subject:
post.author: 6th Venom
post.body:
Thanks for reply der_ton, like i said before, it's not a "critical" bug, 1 minute for search & re-order them is not a crime...
_________________
I just wanna make something not made...

post.date: Posted: Fri Sep 08, 2006 9:07 pm Post subject:
post.author: obihb
post.body:
Just jumping in here but, the last exporter I got did fix the problem for me. Not sure if you might have an older one or maybe it was just lucky?..
_________________
Obi-Wan

post.date: Posted: Fri Sep 08, 2006 9:44 pm Post subject:
post.author: der_ton
post.body:
Obihb, can you please send me your version of the exporter? I remember back then I tried something out and let you test it to see if it works for you, but I think I don't have that anymore.
